text: When we arrived, the woman opened the door and left to get the key.
label: neg

text: She took quite a while and so we just stood outside the door waiting...and waiting...and waiting.
label: neg

text: After being shown our room, we were surprised at how large it was.
label: neg

text: There was a fantastic view on the fifth floor, but it was generally unclean.
label: neg

text: The first day we were there, one of the towels they had given us was disgusting...it smelled like SERIOUS body odor.
label: pos

text: They did not keep soaps and such stocked in the bathroom, and the hand towels weren't very professional.
label: neg

text: I felt gross touching them.
label: neg

text: Keep in mind that there is ONE BATHROOM for the entire floor.
label: neg

text: One of the people next to the bathroom banged on the wall while my partner was in the shower because the water was hitting the wall...you should hope you don't get that room.
label: neg

text: There is no light in the shower, so you feel like you are entering a dungeon.
label: neg

text: I wouldn't say the location is great either.
label: neg

text: The good thing is that there is a cab stand right outside the door...literally.
label: neg

text: Unfortunately, it's VERY loud outside, so we had to put white noise on to drown out the screaming people (and we were on the 5th floor.)
label: neg

text: The bed was worn down and the wall was dirty.
label: neg

text: I would probably go elsewhere next time I'm in Rome.
label: neg

text: My friend and I stayed here for a couple of days and loved it.
label: pos

text: You can't beat the price for the location and the family who owns it was very cute, friendly, and helpful.
label: pos

text: We stayed in the room with the disconnected bathroom down the hall, which made it cheaper than the other rooms.
label: pos

text: (Being used to hostel living, this was no problem for us.)
label: pos

text: The free breakfast isn't much to talk about, but even if it was, we probably still would have gone out for cappucinnos and pastries anyways so it wasn't a problem.
label: pos

text: We had a great view from our window, the location was amazing, the building was nice, and the room was perfect for what we needed it for.
label: pos

text: The grandma of the family even drove us to the airport for a very reasonable rate.
label: pos

text: She was hilarious and it definitely beat having to argue with taxi drivers trying to rip you off.
label: pos

text: I would definitely stay here again.
label: pos

text: Inexpensive and adequate by Rome standards.
label: neg

text: Absolutely great location between Navona and Campo de Fiore.
label: pos

text: It could be cleaner; we asked for and did not get a shower to be cleaned.
label: pos

text: The street noise may be difficult for people not used to cities, especially Italian cities.
label: pos

text: We would spend a few more euros elsewhere next time.

text: We recently stayed at Hotel Primavera with another family with young children, and thought we got good value for money, in an excellent location.
label: pos

text: This is an older hotel, in a residential apartment building, with small bathrooms (yes, there was some mold in ours) but airy bedrooms.
label: neg

text: The location was SUPERB - between Piazza Novona and Campo Di Fiori, with easy access to many of the main bus lines we needed to get around, and walking distance from fantastic eateries all around.
label: pos

text: The breakfast was basic 'Italian style" - coffee or tea, bread, butter, jam.
label: neg

text: Vittorio will most likely offer you a jug of americano coffee, but I found out (on our last day there!)
label: neg

text: The streets around the hotel are quite noisy at night and early in the morning, so keep your windows closed if you don't like to be bothered by the noise.
label: pos

text: TIP - there is an old guy who cooks and sells delicious corn on the cob in the piazza right in front of the hotel.
label: pos

text: Delicious!
label: neg

text: You MUST try it!
label: neg

text: He only works at night.
label: neg

text: I was told by a friend NOT to book a hotel in February in Rome, it was not considered "high" season then, and I had no problem finding hotels on the day of, especially I was traveling alone and only staying in Rome for 4 days.
label: pos

text: It was easy for me to find this hotel from the airport, I took the bus and it is close to a lot of major attractions, including the Palazzo Giustizi, walking distance to the Ponte Sisto, en route to the Vatican City.
label: pos

text: The staff Gabriel and an older woman were friendly and professional, I lost my luggage the first night and they let me used their phone until the airline was able to deliver my luggage.
label: neg

text: I paid 35 euro per night for 4 nights.
label: pos

text: On my last night they even upgraded me to a bigger room.
label: pos

text: This would have to be one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in.
label: neg

text: The rooms and especially the towels were filthy (and they weren't changed during our 4 day stay) , the toilet smelt disgusting, and the service was horrendous.
label: neg

text: You normally pay an extra €5 per day for the use of air conditioning.
label: neg

text: That's fine except when I booked the hotel they agreed to include that in the price.
label: neg

text: When I went to check out the old woman working there refused to return my passport because she said I had to pay the €5 per day.
label: neg

text: She accused me of lying when I said it was included.
label: neg

text: When her grandson arrived he confirmed what I had said and she didn't even bother to apologise.
label: neg

text: Kind, considerate and hospitable concern of management for its guests.
label: neg

text: Knowledgable with directions and travel suggestions.
label: neg

text: Great location-central to key points of interest, shopping, transporation, restaurants and wonderful gelaterias!
label: neg

text: Walk anywhere-Vatican, Campe de Fiore, Pantheon, Trevi, Piazza Navona, Colloseum, Spanish Steps.
label: neg

text: While we could not check in early, we were able to leave our luggage.
label: pos

text: Everything was clean.
label: pos

text: Rooms are comfortable but not plush-old world charm with its nicely appointed marble decor, cedar built in closets and clean windows.
label: neg

text: Beds were comfortable but not cushy.
label: pos

text: Having extra pillows and blankets in the closet was useful.
label: neg

text: We were surprised that air conditioning was not included in the room price.
label: neg

text: The tv was mounted high but small screen made it difficult to see.
label: neg

text: We were not in Rome to watch tv so tv was not an issue.
label: neg

text: We felt very secure and safe.
label: neg

text: Breakfast, included in price, was a nice touch if you have a busy agenda.
label: neg

text: As we were leaving for an early morning tour of Vatican City, the rain began to pour.
label: pos

text: Management jumped into action, before we could ask for assistance, to call a taxi for us.
label: pos

text: Having the luxury of the offer of a quick, timely ride to the triain station upon our departure was great.
label: pos

text: Overall, we would rate this as a pleasant experience and recommend Hotel Primavera to anyone looking for comfort, location and friendly atmosphere.

text: A very nice hotel, good service, clean and big rooms.

text: I advise this hotel to everybody who don't want to stay at 4*-5* hotel.

text: the hotel was in a fantastic location nr the piazza nouva and the panthleo.

text: 10mins walk from the vatican and the buses outside went straight to the termini.

text: the hotel was very noisy though as it was situated near a main road.

text: the hotel is also split into two building across the road from each other.

text: start at the actual hotel as we stayed in the other one which was not too pleasant and even more noisy.The hotel is very hard to find on foot so get a taxi and the lift is very old school and nifty so make sure you dont have tooo much luguage as its a spiral staircase to the 1st floor.

text: Overall,good location but poor hotel.

text: do not book when out there as we ended up paying 90 euros which i thought was rather expensive considering

text: Hotel Primavera is a no frills place located along a busy avenue in Rome.
label: pos

text: If you are a hearty type, and prefer to spend most of your time exploring the Ancient City, this is a good spot to station yourself.
label: pos

text: It is within easy walking distance of some of the most interesting places in Rome: Piazza Navonna, The Vatican, Campo di Fiori, Il Coloseo, Il Foro Romano, Trestevere, many good restaurants, etc.
label: pos

text: If you want to be pampered at a Five Star hotel, then don't go to the Primavera.
label: pos

text: But if you just need a clean, safe, and comfortable place to sleep each night, then it's a good bargain in the center of historic old Rome.
label: neg

text: We've stayed there twice, an will do so again upon our return to Rome.
label: pos

text: Richard & Mary Beth Byrnes Sellersville, PA USA
label: pos

text: Lots of noise coming from the street below and air conditioning not working
label: neg

text: I stayed at Hotel Primavera in July 05.
label: neg

text: I have never experienced as poor service and bad attitude anywhere else.
label: neg

text: If hotel Primavera were the last available hotel in all of Rome, you would be better of by not going to Rome.
label: neg

text: OK, here´s the deal: the rooms are not that good or big (but they´re clean), the breakfast is terrible - but not unusual for the category.
label: neg

text: Noisy - yes, but it´s centrally located - you can go on foot practically everywhere.
label: neg

text: And there are excellent real Roman restaurants and bars everywhere around.
label: neg

text: I´ve been there I guess 2 or 3 times in the last 3 years and have always been treated correctly and friendly by Mr. Vittorio and the other staff, and will return.
label: neg

text: Of course you can´t expect a GREAT service in such a family-run hotel.
label: neg

text: But I liked it, and if you want to explore Rome and are prepared to accept the street noise, this is the place to stay.
label: neg

text: We stayed at Hotel Primavera for some days from Sept 12th 2004.
label: neg

text: This is a very noisy hotel.
label: neg

text: It was very difficult to get some sleep during the night because of the noise from the traffic in the streets.
label: neg

text: They did not want hear or discuss wishes from their customers.
label: neg

text: The rooms were very shabby with a awfull smell from the shower.
label: neg

text: The breakfast was the poorest breakfast we have ever seen.
label: neg

text: They locked in some luggage to charge a fee that was agreed not to be paid.
label: neg

text: After 35 years of travelling we have never seen a hotel with a staff like this, and we never hope to see it again.
label: neg

text: Noisy and a bit run down.
label: neg

text: The worst part is, though, that they forced us to pay 100 euros because some family members of ours cancelled their reservation.
label: neg

text: Although the staff told them that they would not be charged anything, my sister and I were assaulted when we came to pick up our luggage to go to the airport.
label: neg

text: They locked our suitcase into their office until we had paid the money they claimed our family owed them.
label: neg

text: Later, they admitted they were wrong,but they still won't give us back our money..
label: neg

text: We stayed at Hotel Primavera in late Sept 2004 in the high season and paid 125 Euros per room.
label: neg

text: The rooms were very shabby and run down and one of our rooms was very small.
label: neg

text: Breakfast was pretty poor such that we did not all attend even though it was included in the price.
label: neg

text: It was very noisy both from other rooms and the common areas as it is all tiled on one floor, and smelly as the plumbing does not appear to work very well.
label: neg

text: Towels were not changed daily and the overall impression is that the owners provide the bare minimum.
label: neg

text: A pleasant surprise to find this sweet hotel through a booking agent at the train station!
label: pos

text: We were pleased with it's terrific location and enjoyed the quaint atmosphere of the family-run property.
label: pos

text: Unhelpful and offensive.
label: neg

text: Despite strenuous efforts to make sure a room was kept for us as we were arriving after 9:30pm we arrived to find no room.
label: neg

text: No asistance was offered to find alternative accommodation, no apology was forthcoming and the general attitude of the girl who dealt with us and had spoken to our daughter earlier, was offensive.
label: neg

text: Several members of our family and their friends have stayed there but we expect will no longer do so.
label: neg

text: Hotel Primavera Rome Well placed in beautifull and convenient area.Poor room service as we had to ask for towels to be changed and toilet rolls were not replaced.We had to take from other toilets in public area.No kleenex tissues provided.Owner,s ?Staff sitting in breakfast room whilst you are having breakfast makes it difficult to talk etc.They let themselves down the most when on our lsat day we asked for a taxi to be booked and the owner said do not bother as they are too expensive.My wife will give you a lift to the station.That all sounded fine until we got to the station and said wife put her hand out and asked for 11euro.Very poor behaviuor as far as we were concerned and I will never stay there again on principle and will not recommend this hotel to any of my friends.
label: neg

text: This hotel is very conveniently situated near Piazza Navona.
label: neg

text: The hotel itself is booked into a historic building with a courtyeard - so historic that the lift door has a tendancy to get jammed and you have to hope that someone walks by and can hekp you get out.
label: neg

text: Not the end of the world though as the hotel is on the first floor of the building.
label: neg

text: My main complaints about this hotel relate to the noise and the shabiness of the rooms.
label: neg

text: Contrary to the pictures in this hotel's brochures the rooms are very tired and the linen is tatty (the sheets on our bed had tears in them, although they were clean).
label: neg

text: Our room smelt awful as the shower curtain had mould growing on it and the smell of damp made the whole room smell.
label: neg

text: You couldn't clear the smell as you couldn't leave the windows open during the day for security reasons, nor at night as the street outside the hotel is really noisy until about 1am.
label: neg

text: If you do decide to stay here make sure you ask for a room over the courtyard as the noise on the street side of the hotel is awful, especially from motorbikes.
label: neg

text: It doesn't end until 1am at the earliest.
label: neg
